quotes.quote: The art of newspaper paragraphing is to stroke a platitude until it purrs like an epigram.
Newspapers always excite curiosity. No one ever lays one down without a feeling of disappointment.
Newspapers are tutors as well as informers.
Newspapers have degenerated. They may now be absolutely relied upon.
A daily newspaper should report the news, not play at geopolitics.
A newspaper is a mirror reflecting the public, a mirror more or less defective, but still a mirror.
A good newspaper is never quite good enough but a lousy newspaper is a joy forever.
The newspapers are the cemeteries of ideas.
A newspaper is an oversized book with adverts and an expiry date.
For fear of the newspapers politicians are dull, and at last they are too dull even for the newspapers.
Newspapers have roughly the same relationship to life as fortune-tellers to metaphysics.
Newspapers are horror happening to other people.
A newspaper should be the maximum of information, and the minimum of comment.
Newspaper : A device unable to distinguish between a bicycle accident and the collapse of civilisation.
Newspaper readership is declining like crazy. In fact, there's a good chance that nobody is reading my column.
Newspapers should be read for the study of facts. They should not be allowed to kill the habit of independent thinking.
Newspapers are a centre of public culture. We can't give in to extortion.
A newspaper is the lowest thing there is.
A newspaper is always a weapon in somebody's hands.
Accuracy to a newspaper is what virtue is to a lady; but a newspaper can always print a retraction.
Some newspapers are fit only to line the bottom of bird cages.
Owning a newspaper does not confer immunity.
Newspapers have become more important to the average man than the scriptures.
The newspapers are full of what we would like to happen to us and what we hope will never happen to us.
A newspaper is a circulating library with high blood pressure.
Newspapers are so boring. How can you read a newspaper that starts with a 51-word lead sentence?
The newspaper is a greater treasure to the people than uncounted millions of gold.
The newspapers turn a blind eye to how they get their material as long as they have great photographs.
Newspapers don't write enough about serious religious issues.
If newspapers are useful in overthrowing tyrants, it is only to establish a tyranny of their own.
